abstract: South African Pres Jacob Zuma says he will pay back government money he spent on upgrading his personal homestead day after court ruling stating his actions violated Constitution; Zuma apologizes but stops short of taking responsibility, blaming advisers for his legal problems.

headline.print_headline: After Court Ruling, Zuma Agrees to Repay Home Upgrades
headline.main: Jacob Zuma Says He’ll Repay South Africa for Home Improvements

snippet: Mr. Zuma said that the upgrade of his private home had caused “frustration and confusion,” but that he never meant to subvert the Constitution.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Zuma said that the upgrade of his private home had caused “frustration and confusion,” but that he never meant to subvert the Constitution.
